creator: keshlam@us.ibm.com
text:
Note that the trace says this exception is actually being thrown by Xerces, not 
Xalan... which is exactly what I'd expect; Xalan trusts the parser to perform 
these tests. I'm going to reassign this to Xerces, assuming Bugzilla actually 
lets me do so.

Note that the first thing they're likely to request is a copy of the failing 
file; you might want to post it here as an attachment even before they ask.

(Note too that "INVALID" in Bugzilla means "the complaint was not valid", not 
"the document was not valid"; I doubt that's what you meant...)

creator: anthony.leon@ubsw.com
text:
I mis understood the error. 0x80 IS a valid XML character but NOT a valid 
UNICODE character. I mis-interpreted the error thinking it said "0x80 is not 
valid in XML". 

Therefore there is no bug as I can see, so bug hould be closed.
Oops. You _did_ mean to close this as INVALID. My mistake.
